title: Turning Vanes inside the Altitude Wind Tunnel
summary: Men stand in front of turning vanes inside the Altitude Wind Tunnel (AWT) at the National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics Aircraft Engine Research Laboratory in this February 1944 publicity photo. The photo was taken just weeks after the tunnel became operational. The AWT was the only wind tunnel capable of testing full-size aircraft engines in […]

title: Italy’s IRIDE Pathfinder Satellite Beams Back First Views of Earth
summary:
Italy’s HEO Pathfinder satellite, part of the country’s planned IRIDE constellation, has begun its operational phase and transmitted its first imagery from space. The Italian government launched the IRIDE programme in 2022 as part of its National Recovery and Resilience Plan (PNRR), allocating a budget of €1.07 billion. The initiative aims to develop a constellation […]

title: Arnaud Prost | Sky, Sea, Space | ESA Explores #12
summary: Meet Arnaud Prost—aerospace engineer, professional diver, and member of ESA’s Astronaut Reserve. From flying aircraft to getting a taste of spacewalk simulation, his passion for exploration knows no bounds.

title: NASA Employee Meets Success at NASA Stennis
summary: A career path can unfold in unexpected ways. Ask NASA’s Rebecca Mataya. The journey to NASA’s Stennis Space Center near Bay St. Louis, Mississippi, was not planned but “meant to be,” she said.
